item.title: VoIP Phone Service Provides Flexibility
item.description: Businesses of all sizes might be considering upgrading their phone systems but are unsure of the best approach. Should they stick with their existing Key Telephone or PBX system and upgrade it, or is it time to transition to VoIP? What many businesses may not realize is the wide range of options that VoIP solutions offer. The key difference between VoIP and traditional phone systems lies in its network-based approach. While even a single-line phone or cell phone operates on a network, known as the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN), this network has limitations.

item.title: Try VoIP Phone Service For Under $10 a Month
item.description: Ever considered trying out those new VoIP phone services to see if they’re better than your old landline? The ads are tempting, offering combined local and long-distance billing, tons of features without extra charges, and cheap international rates. It all sounds great and much cheaper than your current plan. Hesitations are understandable. Will you like the service? Will it work well with your internet? Maybe long-term contracts, especially at $40-$50 a month, aren’t appealing.

item.title: SOHO VoIP Phone Service With Two Lines at $8.33/mo
item.description: Looking for affordable business or home phone service with great features? Imagine paying just $8.33 a month for a two-line system! This incredible price is possible through VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) technology, which uses your existing broadband connection for phone calls. Competitive providers like Phone Power offer this technology at unbeatable rates. You don’t need special equipmentâ€”simply plug your existing phones into an adapter that allows two simultaneous calls. This means no more waiting for someone to hang up!
